env.name: POSTGRES_USER
env.label: Database User
env.description: It should not be empty and same to each postgresql node cluster.

env.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.label: Database Password
env.description: It should not be empty and same to each postgresql node cluster.

env.name: POSTGRES_DATABASE
env.label: Database Name
env.description: It can be left empty, otherwise the database will be created if doesn't exist.

env.name: REPMGR_PASSWORD
env.label: Replication Password
env.description: It can not be empty, the password should identical to all the postgresql node cluster.

env.name: REPMGR_PRIMARY
env.label: Primary Host
env.description: Hostname or IP address of the primary host, put this node Hostname or IP address if it's the primary node.

env.name: REPMGR_PARTNER_NODE
env.label: Node Machine Cluster
env.description: Hostname or IP address of all the postgresql node cluster (even primary node), the format should like hostname1,hostname2,hostname3:5432 or 192.172.0.1,192.172.0.2,192.172.0.3:5432

env.name: REPMGR_NODE_NAME
env.label: Node ID
env.description: Node ID name of this machine, it should uniq from the other nodes in the cluster. if this node is primary, let the value as node-0 and incremental number to the rest of secondary node

env.name: REPMGR_NODE_NETWORK_NAME
env.label: Node Name
env.description: Netbios or Hostname of this node machine, recommended to use FQDN hostname to globally known.

env.name: POSTGRESQL_POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.label: Root Password
env.description: It's mandatory, can not be empty!.
